title: Discover the Top 10 Emission Reduction Technology Trends in 2023 - StartUs Insights
summary: The article outlines the top 10 global emission reduction technology trends in 2023 based on research on startups and scaleups in the cleantech industry, covering various technologies such as carbon offsetting, artificial intelligence, electrification, green hydrogen, carbon capture, waste valorization, bio-based fuels, emission monitoring, and more.
likely_naics_codes: Likely NAICS Codes: 541715 - Research and Development in the Physical, Engineering, and Life Sciences; 562910 - Remediation Services; 221119 - Other Electric Power Generation; 237130 - Power and Communication Line and Related Structures Construction

title: McCormick freshens up red-cap business with new look, bottle - FoodNavigator-USA.com
summary: McCormick redesigned its herb and spice packaging to focus on freshness and sustainability, using transparent bottles made with 50% recycled plastic to improve freshness and reduce the carbon footprint.
green_innovation: TRUE. This initiative by McCormick to redesign its herb and spice packaging with a focus on freshness and sustainability aligns with green innovation as it aims to reduce negative environmental externalities.
business_innovation: TRUE. McCormick's redesign of its product packaging to enhance freshness and sustainability qualifies as a business innovation as it represents a new approach different from the firm's previous packaging methods.
green_product: TRUE. McCormick's new herb and spice packaging made with 50% post-consumer recycled plastic, designed for improved freshness, transparency, and sustainability, fits the definition of a green product.
green_process: TRUE. McCormick's modified packaging process that pushes air into the bottle to maintain freshness, along with using 50% post-consumer recycled plastic for sustainability, qualifies as a green process.
likely_naics_codes: Likely NAICS Codes: 311942 - Spice and Extract Manufacturing, 493110 - General Warehousing and Storage, 562920 - Materials Recovery Facilities, 325520 - Adhesive Manufacturing
greenwashing: FALSE. The article presents genuine efforts by McCormick to enhance the sustainability and freshness of its herb and spice packaging, without any indication of false or exaggerated environmental claims.
